result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Jordan Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business Monday 9/12/22.  
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed! 
Defendant is not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting, meeting, or in a correctional setting. 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.
Financial obligation to be paid through the county at $25 a month starting on or before 10/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.
Financial obligation to be paid through the county at $25 a month starting on or before 10/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.

The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days. 
Any contraband seized to be forfeited!

records.addlTxt: 8:38 AM Defendant Andrew Jordan Adams appeared by video.  Attorney John A Best appeared by video for Andrew Jordan Adams.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF64 and 22CF67.  Def was late joining hearing.  State sent email to Atty.  Atty asking to have a break out room with def.  Back on the record at 8:44.  Atty matter is resolved.  Parties have agreement.  Back in breakout room with attorney.  Back on the record at 8:48.  Def is waiving right to personal appearance, discussed with attorney.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Atty, def pleads GUILTY.  Each file contains PLQ, understands in formation, rights giving up, charges, and elements.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts GUILTY pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on information in the complaints, parties agree.  Court finds a factual  basis exists and finds def GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Court reviewed letter from def that is in the file.  See attached for sentencing.
